definition: to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet

sentences.english: More guards, carrying six wooden coffins, made their way to a wall on the prison's seaward side.
sentences.chinese: 又有幾個守衛扛着六具棺木朝監獄靠海的一面牆走去。

sentences.english: Then the French came up with semi-private jails, in which the state employs only the guards;
sentences.chinese: 之後法國開始出現半私立監獄，即僅由國家僱用守衛。

sentences.english: A group of armed guards have arrived and are waiting outside the gate.
sentences.chinese: 一隊武裝警衛抵達並守衛在牢房區大門處。

sentences.english: Covenant base ship and fleet are here en masse guarding Delta Halo.
sentences.chinese: 聖約人的基地飛船和艦隊都在這裏守衛德爾塔光暈。

sentences.english: It takes strength to stand guard.
"Guard the opening, you two, " Kurt ordered Lucy and Tom.
sentences.chinese: “守衛開口，你們兩個，”庫爾特命令露西和湯姆。

sentences.english: These are located inside the guard tower that sits in front of the Penitentiary.
sentences.chinese: 這些在位於監獄前面的守衛塔裏。

sentences.english: A pair of guards dragged a prisoner in through the tower's stone doorway.
sentences.chinese: 兩個守衛把一個囚犯拖進來，穿過塔樓的石梯入口。

sentences.english: I'm going to go guard the Queen and stand outside the palace in my tunic.
sentences.chinese: 我要去守衛女王，穿着制服站在宮殿外。

sentences.english: The frontiers of the City are indeed guarded by dragons.
sentences.chinese: 這座城市的確是由龍來守衛邊境的。

sentences.english: Fixed a problem that prevented Watcher Wards from being revealed by the Dust of Appearance.
sentences.chinese: 修正了哨崗守衛不被顯形之塵顯現的問題。

sentences.english: The camp was guarded by armed soldiers and ringed with high fences and rolls of razor wire.
sentences.chinese: 武裝守衛的營地由高高的柵欄隔離並繞滿了鐳射線。

sentences.english: Thrice they passed Unsullied guards, standing as if they had been carved from stone.
sentences.chinese: 有三次他們路過無垢者守衛，他們像石雕般站立着。

sentences.english: An organ played, a choir sang, police guarded the doors.
sentences.chinese: 風琴鳴奏，合唱響起，警察守衛着各扇大門。

sentences.english: The prisoners are guarded by two armed men on foot and two armed horsemen.
sentences.chinese: 囚犯守衛的兩名武裝人員和兩名徒步武裝騎兵。

sentences.english: These faithful guardians seemed unwilling to surrender their treasure .
sentences.chinese: 這些忠實的守衛者似乎不願交出他們的寶藏。

definition: to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
an execution/to put sb to death
to drive (vehicle)/to drive out/to chase away/to herd (people towards a gate)
to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
to monitor/to keep a close watch over/surveillance
to glare like a tiger watching his prey (idiom)/to eye covetously
